info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 12:25PM PDT until March 19 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 2 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches, with higher amounts along higher peaks. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County above 5000 feet including small portions of Sawyers Bar Road and Highway 3 south of Callahan. The advisory also includes a portion of the Pacific Crest Trail. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 2 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Trails may become hard to follow where markers are scarce. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 30 to 40 percent chance that snowfall rates could reach 1"/hr. While snow is generally not expected to stick to roads, it could under these heavier snowfall rates. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
